resources.string: Enrollment date can\'t be in future.

Is the index patient DST result available?
Is the contact currently taking TB treatment?
Is contact registered in Zero TB program?
Has the contact taken TB treatment in past?
Index patient\'s relationship with contact e.g. \'Mother\' means Index is Mother of Contact
What type of Address is this?
Does contact have weight loss or failure to thrive?
Does the contact have glandular swelling anywhere in body?
Has the contact been referred to the facility?
Type of Facility the contact is referred to
Index Id and Contact id can\'t be same.
Contact\'s Highest Level of Education Attainment
Who is patient\'s head of household within his/her family?
Highest Level of Education Attainment of Head of Household
Lumps in neck, armpit or groin
Is the index case contact’s mother?
Is the index case contact’s primary care giver?
Does the index case sleep in the same bed as the contact?
Does the index case sleep in the same room as the contact?
Does the index case and contact live in the same household?
Does the index case see the contact everyday?
Does the index case have pulmonary TB?
Does the index case have positive sputum smear?
Is there more than one index case in contact’s household?
Is the physical examination suggestive of TB
Do you have any co-existing medical condition?
Does the contact need referral for his/her condition?
Has the patient been referred for TB treatment?
Has TB disease been ruled out?
Does the contact agree to take PET?
Baseline Screening form is missing. If form is already submitted to openmrs, try updating patient.
Treatment initiation form is missing. If form is already submitted to openmrs, try updating patient.
Rifapentine dose should be in 300 - 450 mg
Rifapentine dose should be in 450 - 900 mg
Is there a need for ancillary drugs?
Relationship of treatment supporter with the patient
Contact\'s psychiatric and general medical condition
Has the clinician asked for a clinical visit of the contact?
Has the contact been referred to the clinician?
How many days worth of medication was missed in the past month?
Are complaints consistent with drug-side effects?
Is the contact adherent to PET?
Who is giving medicines to child contact?
Are there any behavioural complains since starting PET?
Are the parents/caretakers negligent towards PET?
Is the Index patient following infection control measures?
Counseling of the index patient for infection control
Is the patient facing any of these problems?
